definition: to hold/to grasp/to support/to maintain/to persevere/to manage/to run (i.e. administer)/to control

sentences.english: Sister long unrestrained, can not find the direction of modesty.
sentences.chinese: 姊长期奔放，找不到矜持的方向。

sentences.english: She smiled and some of her natural reserve melted .
sentences.chinese: 她微微一笑，那天生的矜持也随之消失。

sentences.english: It has lost its noble and reserved character .
sentences.chinese: 它失去了高贵和矜持的特性。

sentences.english: Pride does not consort with poverty.
She is just like other Americans who are so used to Chinese student's being silent or reserved.
sentences.chinese: 她和许多美国人一样，习惯了中国学生的沉默或矜持。

sentences.english: Dong Wenbin was stunned, he said that girls should be reserved some.
sentences.chinese: 董文彬有些惊呆，他说女孩子应该矜持一些。

sentences.english: He had an incisive, quickmotioned, self-sufficient manner .
sentences.chinese: 他具有机敏，轻捷，矜持的态度。

sentences.english: Chu Xiangshi inevitably be reflected in the restrained and careful.
sentences.chinese: 初相识，免不了的是矜持和小心翼翼。

sentences.english: As Nisan and I talked, Nemutan stared demurely at her pumpkin soup.
sentences.chinese: 我和尼森聊着天，而音梦正矜持地盯着自己的南瓜汤。

sentences.english: Sour is the heart of shepherd, reserved and sprang inside a blossom of virgin love.
sentences.chinese: 酸是情窦初开而内心矜持的牧羊人。

sentences.english: How many people and things in their fragile lives could bear feigning ignorance or strangeness?
sentences.chinese: 脆弱的人生又能有多少人和事经得起装蒜与矜持？

sentences.english: The hostess broke the ice by introducing the strangers to each other.
sentences.chinese: 女主人将生客作彼此介绍以打破矜持的气氛。

definition: affecting shyness or embarrassment/coy/mincing (walk, manner of speech)/mannered
to contain/to hold/(of a person or style etc) reserved/restrained/(of words, writings) full of hidden meaning/implicit/veiled (criticism)
affecting shyness or embarrassment/coy/mincing (walk, manner of speech)/mannered
noble and virtuous/aloof from politics and material pursuits
